etymology.description: 王 (surname Wang) + 老吉 (Old Ji; honorific + given name/nickname) = brand name of a herbal tea.
etymology.interpretation: Formed from the founder’s surname Wang and his nickname “Old Ji” (Cantonese: Lo Kat), conveying respect and auspiciousness. Widely recognized as a Guangdong herbal tea brand.

parts.english: Old Ji (nickname); venerable + auspicious; Lo Kat (Cantonese)

examples.chinese: 我想喝一罐王老吉(我想喝一罐王老吉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng hē yī guàn Wánglǎojí.
examples.english: I want to drink a can of Wong Lo Kat.

examples.chinese: 这款饮料在广东很受欢迎(這款飲料在廣東很受歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuǎn yǐnliào zài Guǎngdōng hěn shòu huānyíng.
examples.english: This beverage is very popular in Guangdong.

examples.chinese: 由于商标纠纷，内地产品改名为加多宝(由於商標糾紛，內地產品改名為加多寶)。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú shāngbiāo jiūfēn, nèidì chǎnpǐn gǎimíng wéi Jiāduōbǎo.
examples.english: Due to a trademark dispute, the mainland product was renamed JDB.
